inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: MRI showed a spinal cord conus mass which was biopsied and found to be anaplastic astrocytoma

inclusion.criterion: recurrent disease, histologically proven or imaging suggestive of recurrent disease
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Patient initially presented with RLE weakness where his right knee gave out with difficulty walking and right anterior thigh numbness.

inclusion.criterion: ability to understand and willingness to sign a written informed consent document
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: The patient is a 45-year-old man who can understand and sign a written informed consent document.

inclusion.criterion: age greater than or equal to 18 years old
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: The patient is a 45-year-old man, which meets the age criterion.

inclusion.criterion: no more than two prior disease relapses for phase I portion of study
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: tumor tissue available for review to confirm histological diagnosis
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Tumor block or unstained slides must be available for molecular profiling.

inclusion.criterion: recovered from toxic effects of prior therapy to less than grade 2 toxicity per CTC version 4
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: prior bevacizumab use for tumor treatment
exclusion.label: triggers
exclusion.evidence: Patients who are receiving any other investigational agents. However, prior enrollment on a study using investigational agents is acceptable

exclusion.label: triggers
exclusion.evidence: Patients who are receiving any other investigational agents

notes: Patient has a history of anaplastic astrocytoma and has undergone prior standard therapy. The patient is currently experiencing progressive lower extremity weakness and urinary retention.
